attributes.action: erect a suitable monument to Alan Turing in Trafalgar Square, St Paul's Cathedral, or the environs of Whitehall, as a man who played a fundamental role in the defeat of Nazism and for his services to mathematics, logic, cryptanalysis and computer science.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Alan Turing was a pioneering figure in the history of computer science, a key contributor to breaking the Enigma code, and a leading figure in the fight against Nazism. Turing is a national hero, and it is only fitting that Turing has a monument in our nation’s capital. As we come towards the 70th anniversary of the cracking of the Nazi Codes it would be a suitable memorial to the unity and the purpose of all free peoples in those dark days if Turing received a monument alongside other great heroes of the nation.

rejection.details: Statues and memorials are not normally sponsored by central Government but usually result from private initiatives. The promoters of a statue or memorial can achieve their aims by setting up a Charitable Trust, identifying a site and commissioning a designer, raising the necessary finance and obtaining the appropriate consents from the relevant planning authorities. The fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square is a matter for the Mayor of London.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
